characters: ON THE SIDE OF THE TRAIN
SONG TO INCORPORATE THE FOLLOWING SENTIMENTS
FROM THE OTHER END OF THE HALLWAY
YELLOW EYES, FIFTY BLOOD RED MOUTHS AND THOUSANDS OF SHAR
YOU DON'T WANT TO BE AROUND
THINGS MY HEART USED TO KNOW
SOMEONE HOLDS ME SAFE AND WARM
"PARIS HOLDS THE KEY TO YOUR HEART", (PRODUCTION NUMBER)
AT THE OTHER END OF THE DOCK
A SMOKY IMAGE OF THE SAME SCENE
"ONCE UPON A DECEMBER", (THE MUSIC BOX THEME)
THIS IS THE END OF THE ROMANOV

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: on a well-worn PHOTOGRAPH ALBUM. An ELDERLY WOMAN'S HAND touched the album, caressing it lovingly for a moment, as WE HEAR her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we lived in an enchanted world. . .  She opend the ALBUM to reveal a BLACK AND WHITE PHOTOGRAPH of the PALACE AT ST. PETERSBERG on a brilliant summer day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A world of Tsars and Princesses and elegant palaces. . .  CAMERA MOVES CLOSER TO the picture. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and grand parties. . .  The PHOTO dissolves into REALITY in brilliant color as the day turns into night and the summer cools into winter. We see the palace at night, blanketed in a beautiful, almost glowing, snow as hourse drawn carriages pull up to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful, magical time. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would soon be gone forever. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elegant ROYALISTS mingle around the MAIN HALL as an ORCHESTRA plays. All eyes turn to the GLASS DOORS OF TWO ELEVADORS which descend grandly on either side of a beautiful staircase. Through the glass doors we see TATIANA, the Dowager Empress, 60, imperious and bedecked with jewels, she is seemingly unapproachable. TSAR NICHOLAS and his SON are with her. In the other elevador, ALEXANDRA and her daughters - well,  all her daughters except. . .  ANASTASIA, eight years old and apparently late for the party, rushes down the upstairs hallway followed by a SERVENT (SONYA) 16,  who is trying to catch up with Anastasia to tie a large ribbon in her long, dark hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Princess Anastasia - you're late and it's all my  fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Sonya, no one'll notice. . .  Just then, Sonya lassoes the ribbon around her hair, stopping Anastasia with a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . .  owwwwwwwww! All eyes turn to Anastasia, who once she realizes that she's the center of attention, flashes a mischievous smile and descends the staircase in grand style. As the ribbon falls out of her hair and down her back, Anastasia kicks it to Sonya without breaking stride. Tatiana sees her and can't help but smile. The music suddenly becomes  a FLOURISH OF TRUMPETS. SERVENTS open the elevador doors as the ROYAL FAMILY steps out and begins a proccession through their subjects. Tatiana holds out her arm to Anastasia as she makes it to Tatiana's side just in time. Anastasia has a beautiful but slightly impish face, dominated by large, blue, mischievous eyes. She an abundance of  energy and confidence for a girl her age.

dialogues.speaker: "THE RULARS OF RUSSIA", (OPENING NUMBER)
dialogues.text: The elegant guests sing their admiration as the beautiful and happy Romanov family makes it's entrance into the ball, they're "the  pride of all Russia". Vladimir invites Sophie to dance and the entire glittering assembly assembly swings into a GLORIOUS SWEEP WALTZ. Singing their certainty that the Romanovs will rule forever. During the above, the ball is in full swing. Beautiful COUPLES swirls across the dance floor, including Anastasia dancing gracefully with her father. Under a long buffet table, we see DMITRI, 11, darkly handsome, dressed in ragged servant clothes, with a shock of dark hair which continuoually falls accross his eyes as watches the guest enviously. Anastasia, still waltzing with her father, sees him. SERVENTS cross the room carrying a trays of BEAUTIFUL TROPICAL FRUIT. The guests "Ew" and "ah" at the sumptuous fruit. Anastasia sees Dmitri eyeing it hungrily and without missing a dance step, she grabs an orange off thr tray and tosses it to Dmitri. He catches it and smiles broadly at her. Suddenly, A HAND grabs Dmitri and pulls him out from under the table. It's IVAR, the HEAD SERVENT, who pulls Dmitri into an open wall panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a servent! Never forget your place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday my place will be out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never! You're a peasant, Dmitri! Back in the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: RULARS OF RUSSIA, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: UNDERSCORE CONTINUES as Dmitri is dragged from his hiding place under the table and back to the kitchen. It's like the Moscow circus back there, COMIC MUSICAL CONFUSION. The servants sing about their demanding employers and mockingly imitate their behavior:  they imply that they have their own "party",  that change is coming. While back in the ballroom, the Royalists are oblivious to the servants discontent and sing their satisfaction with their own lives. DRAMATIC UNDERSCORE CONTINUES though the following scenes.

dialogues.speaker: ON TATIANA
dialogues.text: in a large throne-like chair. Tatiana is very serious and very regal. She slides over to make room for Anastasia who sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you so late tonight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was showing Sonya something . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you showing her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were told not to tutor your servants anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I had to because . . . Anastasia looks up at Tatiana and sees her smile with pride.  Anastasia knows she doesn't have to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuddling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Grandmama, why do you have to go back to Paris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's where I've made my home but I do have something for you . . . Tatiana reaches from behind the chair and brings out a beautiful MUSIC BOX.  Tatiana takes the key, a small silver and enamel flower, on a silver neck chain and winds it up. MUSIC BEGINS, she hands Anastasia the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the key bearing the inscription "Together in Paris".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Together in Paris"! Oh, when can we be "together in Paris?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're older . . . Anastasia makes a disgruntled face. Tatiana laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until then, whenever you hear this song, think of me and know that I'm waiting for you. Tatiana puts the key around Anastasia's neck and they embrace. Then, suddenly . . .

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GRAND CHANDELIER
dialogues.text: the lights begin to fade in and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as PEOPLE in the ballroom look around bewildered. Then, a WHIRLWIND kicks up, sending everyone off the dance floor, as the whirlwind becomes a TORNADO. Suddenly, an ALBINO BAT (BARTOK) with huge eyes, springs out of the funnel, screeching and swooping over the crowd, causing everyone to duck and cover their heads in fear. The tornada reaches it's peak and EXPLODES in smoke - leaving RASPUTIN standing alone in the middle of the floor. He is of indeterminate age, towering over other men in the room, his most striking feature are his eyes - which at this moment are burning a fiery red. He is dressed in a flowing black monk's robe with a satin rope tied around his waist. Connected to the rope is a glowing RELIQUARY, a mystical lantern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Nicholas, Alexandra, Sophie and Vladimir, Dmitri peeking out ofthe wallpanel, Tatiana and Anastasia, all of whom are frightened.

dialogues.speaker: NICHOLAS
dialogues.text: as he gathers his son and wife to his side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rasputin!  You're alive . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (advancing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite being shot, poisoned and thrown into an icy river . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (honestly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had nothing to do with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave the orders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did no such thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all I've done for your family - YOU TRIED TO KILL

dialogues.speaker: MEEEEEE
dialogues.text: Rasputin swings the reliquary, wrapping himself in smoke which seems to grow larger. Eerie moaning noises come from the reliquary. PEOPLE back awayin terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Romanov dynasty ends here! You, your wife and children will all die within the fortnight!

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Anastasia leaves Tatiana and rushes to stand in front of her father. Still holding her Music Box, Anastasia's shaking hands are the only thing that gives away her  fear. Rasputin spins toward the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not afraid of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You . . .  my little babushka . . . you'll be so much fun to kill  that I'll save you for last! Twirling the reliquary again, the MOANS grow louder as Bartok circles around his head. The smoke that emerges seems to have almosy a human shape to it.

dialogues.speaker: LINE
dialogues.text: The tornada of smoke begins again, whipping into a frenzy and then EXPLODING. The smoke clears and Rasputin is gone. As the lights return to normal the Romanov family all stand together, and try to look regal and in control once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some say Rasputin ad harnessed all the dark powers of evil and  that it was his curse which  brought about the end . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the ROMANOV FAMILY fades into a PORTRAIT OF THE FAMILY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never know for sure. All I do know is that the beauty of our world was soon Gone . . .  Forever . . . a lick of BRIGHT ORANGE FLAME creeps into view.

dialogues.speaker: "RULERS OF RUSSIA", (VOCAL REPRISE)
dialogues.text: HUGE, OMINOUS VOCALS reprise the onceglorious watlz of the Romanovs, heralding the end of their world and underscoring the coming revolution.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: to see the PORTRAIT, a huge FRIEZE which covers an entire entire wall, singeing as the FLAME creeps up the n drapery, tinting the room in a red glow. A SCREAMING MOB, some in uniform, some not, has crashed into the palace and is heading up the stairs. A few in the mob fire off orange RIFLE SHOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anastasia BOLTS UP, hearing the shots. Her music box is next to her on her nightstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mass confusion as the MOB is met by a few SERVANTS, who try to stop them from advancing. More shots.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROMANOV'S
dialogues.text: still in nightclothes, are being rushed down the hallway. Tatiana is next to Anastasia as Anastasia stopsdead in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My music mox! Anastasia turns around and runs back down the hall. Tatiana tries to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anastasia, no! It's too late, Anastasia fights her way back into her room, with Tatiana following her.

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE OTHER END OF THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: we see Dmitri watching amidst all the confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anastasia grabs her music box as Tatiana rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, child! LOUD RIFLE SHOTS are heard as Dmitri bursts into the room, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - this way! Dmitri runs to a wall panel and thows his weight against it. It opens, revealing a passage way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!  Run!!  Out the servant's quarters! Tatiana, enormously grateful, looks at Dmitri as he flips his hair out of his face unconsciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Tatiana goes in as Dmitri shoves Anastasia toward the passageway, knocking the music box out of her hand.  She reaches for it, but hearing the mob voices growing closer, he pushes her through the panel without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Tatiana quickly follows Anastasia into the passageway and Dmitri closes the panel JUST AS the mob bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying to the mob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's here! Let's try the next room! The MOB, accepts the word of a peasant boy and rushes out. Dmitri picks up the music box and looks sadly toward the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is under siege by ROYALISTS trying to board the overcrowded train and the REVOLUTIONARIES who are trying to stop them. A TOURING CAR pulls up RIGHT ON THE TRACKS behind the caboose as the train starts to pull away. Tatiana and Anastasia climb out of the car and race for the train, fighting their way through the frenzied and frightened crowd. WE HEAR shouts of "The Empress - let her through!" which helps clear the way. Anastasia reaches the train first, then turns to see Tatiana. trying to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, Grandmama!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on! Anastasia, get on! Anastasia refuses to board the train.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD
dialogues.text: A MOB OF REVOLUTIONARIES block the tracks with a TRUCK

dialogues.speaker: ON ANASTASIA
dialogues.text: who pushes Tatiana up the stairs of the caboose. This puts Anastasia a few steps behind as the train speeds up. Tatiana is gripped by other passengers as she reaches out to Anastasia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab my hand! Anastasia reaches up and takes Tatiana's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the TWO HANDS. then suddenly. her small hand is pulled from Tatiana's grasp and falls out of the frame.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANASTASIA
dialogues.text: who has stumbled, hitting the ground hard.

dialogues.speaker: ON TATIANA
dialogues.text: horrified, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: ANASTASIA
dialogues.text: Tatiana rushes to jump off the train after her, but is caught and held back by the ROYALIST PASSANGERS as the train CRASHES through the truck and picks up speed. TATIANA's POV: Anastasia rising from the ground, her hand outstretched. But she is suddenly swallowed up by the mob.

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK AND WHITE PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: of Anastasia, in a happier time, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw her again. . .  The PHOTO ALBUM slowly closes. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gray and ugly, post-revolution building with a sign above the door that identifies it:  "Young Comrades Without Parents".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHILDREN of all ages clean the cold, gray dormitory. Their clothes are ragged and they look underfed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANYA, 18, pretty despite the boy's hand-me-down clothes she is forced to wear, is busy scrubbing the floor. Unlike the others, she is determined not to let her surroundings get to her. She hums a tune. The door suddenly SLAMS open and GREGOR, 8, and clearly terrified, comes running in followed by COMRADE PHLEGMENKOF - a huge woman carrying a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya! Anya! All of the OTHER KIDS turn away, not wanting to get involved.  Anya focuses on Gregor, who  is shivering with fright and on the verge of tears as Phlegmenkof approaches, swinging the switch menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't get away from me now . . . Phlegmenkof advances on Gregor.  Anya takes the scrub brush and SHOVES it across the floor, right under Phlegmenkof's unsuspecting foot.  Phlegmenkof's feet fly out from under her and she SMASHES to the floor. Gregor hops over her huge body and runs to Anya for safety. Some of the OTHER KIDS glance over. A CHUBBY GIRL and a very pretty LITTLE GIRL, look at Anya with greeat admiration . . .  someof the OTHERS think she's crazy. Phlegmenkof rises, covered with soap bubbles , and spins on Anya - who gives her a very innocent smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! You did this! Some of the OTHER CHILDREN laugh as soap bubbles fly off the enraged woman.  She spins on them, her back to Anya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brats!  There'll be no supper for any of you!  Back to work! Anya, behind Phlegmenkof, mimics her outraged face and angry gestures perfectly - as the CHILDREN laugh harder. Phlegmenkof spins and almost catches Anya.  She advances on Anya as Gregor hides behind her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Anya)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ragged, skinny, little nothing!  I have had just about enough of you . . . Phlegmenkof raises her hand to slap Anya, who hold her ground.  Suddenly, Phlegmenkof SNIFFS the air.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE KIDS
dialogues.text: as the horrible smell reaches them too.  They all make faces and hold their noses.

dialogues.speaker: ON PHLEGMENKOF
dialogues.text: who first sniffs under her raised arm, then realized the cause of the stench . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comrade Serebreakov! She tries to straighten herself out nervously - this must be someone very important. COMRADE SEREBREAKOV stands in the doorway, lecherously eyeing the girls.  He is a huge, fleshly man with facial

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flirting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comrade Serebreakov!  What a lovely surprise! What brings you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need. . . a worker. His eye catches Anya. He looks her up and down, his beady eyes showing a touch of lust for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take her. He leans close close to Anya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow you begin your life's work in my hearing factory. You'll start by cutting off the tails - but if I'm pleased with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you - you just may move up to cutting off the heads.  How does that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About as bad as you smell! Phlegmenkof moves between them, pulling Serebreakov away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Comrade - you don't want her . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's horrible, skinny thing?! She's crazy - she has no memory of anything before she came here! She didn't even know her name! That one is a rotten troublemaker, willful. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll break her will. . . (to Anya)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall come for you tomorrow at dawn. (he touches her face as she pulls away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will enjoy serving under me. Smiling in anticipation, he exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't break you - but he can! And she turns to leave in a huff. Anya does one more imitation of her, making the CHILDREN laugh. But as Anya turns away from her audience, we see her facade fade and realize her terror of the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHILDREN huddle in their cots under tattered, thin blankets. Anya is fully dressed, illuminated by the light of a FULL MOON, she ties a dull gray sheets togethe and anchors the "rope" to an ice cold radiator and throws the other end out of the window.  She is about to climb out when she looks at the sleeping children and smiles sadly. She walks over to Gregor's bed and puts one hand lovingly on his head and then reaches over and takes the hand of a sleeping LITTLE GIRL, who opens her eyes and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya? The other childern wake up as Anya gently "shushes" him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you running away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm running to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running to? Running to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find my home. A CHUBBY TWELVE YEAR OLD GIRL looks at Anya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you are home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This isn't a home - it's  just a building. Home is where you belong and none of us belong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is your home, Anya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure but look. . . Anya shows Gregor the key around her neck. CLOSE UP on the inscription:  "Together in Paris"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says "Together in Paris". I was wearing this when I came here ten years ago - it's the only way that I know . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . .  that I must have been someone someone loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your home in Paris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be. I have to go and find out. Anya smiles lovingly at the children.

dialogues.speaker: "A SOMEPLACE AND A SOMEONE"
dialogues.text: (Anya's "I want" song).  Anya SINGS SOFTLY to the children about how all she has is the key around her neck to the "someone and thesomeplace" she was "lost from long ago".  She tells the children that she must go find them again. UNDERSCORE continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go now, before it gets light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if we can't ever find where we came from?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll have to make your own home. Lots of people do. Anya embraces the children and walks to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous, sad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya! What if we can't find anyone who loves us?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then come find me. Gregor is relieved and cuddles into his bed as Anya smiles lovingly and crawls out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya begins to climb down the street, testing the knots. The knotshold tight, but the old sheet RIPS in half, sending her PLUMMETING into a snow drift.  From the depths of the snow we HEAR her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope there's no snow in Paris. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glorious bright (and cold) dawn creeps over the horizon. Anya stands at  edge of the hill, looking down on the city of ST.PETERSBURG. The old gray orphanage looms behind her. Anya "borrows" an old, beat-up bicycle from the orphanage and rides down the hill. Music picks up in energy and excitement as Anya zooms on her way bumping and bouncing downhill as the sunrises and St. Petersburg looms nearer.

dialogues.speaker: "A SOMEONE AND A SOMEPLACE", (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Music becomes UPTEMPO, HOPEFUL, ACTIVE, ACTIVE. Anya SING - full of hope, energy and excitement as she peddls her rickety bike toward the city. "Her heart is on its way" and nothing is going to stop her. Anya passes though the countryside toward the city. A peasant family waves to her as she goes by. A Gypsy Troupe performs tricks by the side of the road. A very fancy car zooms by.

dialogues.speaker: "A SOMEONE AND A SOMEPLACE", (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Anya SINGS, imagining who she might be -- anyone from a peasant to a princess! But it doesn't matter as long as she finds her real family. People stare at her as she rides into the edge of the city. She is captivated by all the activity:  cars, busses, stores, long lines of people, etc.

dialogues.speaker: "A SOMEONE AND A SOMEPLACE", (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Anya SINGS -- in this sea faces, there must be someone who has a clue to her identity.  She'll stop at nothing to find the someone who once loved her.  SOARING MUSICAL AND VOCAL CONCLUSION.

dialogues.speaker: END MUSICAL NUMBER
dialogues.text: Anya does not see a cute little PUPPY (MEETOO) with a HUGE BONE in his mouth, being chased along the sidewalk by a pack of much larger, vicious DOGS until he bolts across Anya's path forcing her to skid to a stop. She watched him as he scoots into an alley, followed by the angry pack. On reflex, Anya drops the bike and reuns into the alley after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meetoo is trapped.  The PACK surrounds him, ready to pounce when Anya LEAPS into the middle of the circle. The PACK is startled, but begins to advance on both Anya and Meetoo. Anya doesn't know what to do. She crouches and then. . .  growls back at them, making her eyes look as ferocious as possible. The PACK exchange a confused look; there's a girl growling at them. Meetoo stands, suddenly brave, behind her and growls along with her. Suddenly, Anya pounced toward the pack, growling louder. The pack has definately had enough - some start to back out quizzically, others turn and run like hell. Anya turns to Meetoo, who looks up at her gratefully, wagging his tail. Anya picks up the bone and puts it back in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should be more careful about who you invite to dinner! Meetoo nods and lets out a little "bark" that sounds as if he were saying "retu".  Anya pats him and heads back to her bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya rides down the street. She doesn't see Meetoo, running like a little maniac behind her. Anya approaches a STERN LOOKING BUILDING with a sign over the door: "The People's Bureau of Bureaucracy". She leaps off her bike and heads up the stais. Meetoo, breathing heavily from his run, follows and almost reaches her when the heavy door slams in his face.  He slumps against it, panting, his little paw-to chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya enters and STOPS when she sees. . . LINES and LINES of people which seem to go on forever.  She walks down the side of one line, trying to figure out which one to stand in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could someone tell me. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All lines are good lines. PEASANT 1, 2, & 3 (in unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our beloved Soviet Union! They turn toward an armed Soviet Guard and smile sweetly, hoping he heard their flattery.  He did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. . .  He jots something down in his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANYA
dialogues.text: as she gets closer to the window. She turns to the person behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the right line to get papers to travel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travel? Travel to where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Paris. I have to get to Paris PEASANT 5, in front of her, turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris?!  What do they have in Paris that they don't have here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shorter lines?! Peasant 6 is immediately carted off by TWO ARMED GUARDS for his blasphamy against the state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody leaves Soviet Russia. The OTHER PEASANTS join in with variations of "Nobody leaves Russia" as Anya reaches the window and speaks to the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this where I get traveling papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be if we let you travel which we  don't so it isn't. (loudly, for all to hear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russia is the people's  paradise! And to further make his point, he slams shut his window, which immediately opens a crack as he whispers to Anya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See Dmitri. He can help. He shuts the window, only to open it again immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't hear it from me. He shuts the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't get it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't He opens it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The clerk sticks out a sign:  "Samovar Break - back in ten minutes" and slams the window shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya steps out of the building, still not seeing Meetoo and looks around at the hoards of people waiting in lines for everything:  bread, gas, clothes, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dmitri? There must be a million Dmitris. . .

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW ANYA
dialogues.text: as she wades into the crowded street. Meetoo getting tangled in the legs of waiting Soviets. Anya stops suddenly. She sniffs the air.  Her eyes widen as she recognizes the stench that is floating through the air.  She spins around and sees Serebreakov DIRECTLY ACROSS THE STREET. Serebreakov is on a mission to find Anya.  He turns in her direction just as a bus passes.  Anya is gone. We now see Anya clinging to the side of the bus as it drives down the street. Meetoo looks, his face dropping - he knows he'll never catch up to her now.  Then he sees the bus hit a huge pothole and Anya is knocked off into the mud.  Happily, Meetoo trots off in her direction. Anya approaches TWO PEASANTS who are waiting in line in front of a cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Peasant 10)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which line is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line to get into the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, do you know Dmitri. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! PEASANTS 9 & 10 (whispering simultaneously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try the tavern/ library. They begin to bicker back and forth in forced whispers as to wether Dmitri is at the tavern or the library. Exasperated, Anya walks away.  They call after her. PEASANTS9& 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we didn't tell you! Anya rolls her eyes in frustration.  She doesn't see Meetoo at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish they'd all stop telling me they didn't tell me! Meetoo gives a "retu" of agreement. Anya looks down and sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing. . . Just then, she catches another whiff of something foul in the air. Anya duck quickly into a doorway and loses Meetoo. Anya peeks out. A GARBAGE WAGON full of dead fish and rotten food passes Anya.  She sighs with relief, it wasn't Serebreakov - it just smelled like him. Anya steps out of the doorway and approaches a STREET ARTIST sketching a LARGE PEASANT WOMAN as her TINY HUSBAND looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Artist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you get rid of her moustache?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me - I'm looking for a man named Dmitri. . . The Artist quickly scribbles and address on his pad and hands it to her without turning around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't write it. Anya looks down at the note

dialogues.speaker: NOTE
dialogues.text: "St. Petersburg Art Theatre - 99 Pushkin Street"

dialogues.speaker: A SIGN
dialogues.text: "Pushkin Street"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where WE HEAR a cacophony of FEMALE VOICES as the camera moves inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiting room is filled with YOUNG WOMEN, of various shapes and sizes, holding reading aloud from a piece of paper. WE HEAR many variations of "Oh, Grandmama! It's me, Anastasia. I've waited so long to see you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ACTRESS stands in front of what looks to be an OLD WOMAN in a shawl who's back is to the "audience".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the top)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Grandmama! It's me, Anastasia! I've waited so long to see you! The Actress then LUMBERS over to the OLD WOMAN, with a gait like John Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to see the "Old Woman" is Vladimir, with a shawl over his head.  He looks older, of course, but with the same dapper mustache. He rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out to audience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dmitri!  I can not work with her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Actress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I remind you that you are supposed to be Princess - not a lazy lumbering lout!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SEATS
dialogues.text: is Dmitri. Now 20 and darkly handsome. His hair still falling in his eyes as he flips it off his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vladimir, calm down! Vladimir walks off the stage and toward Dmitri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, my friend, as an exercise in futility! We shall never find a girl to play the Princess Anastasia out of this motley crew of commoners! Vladimir dramatically throws one end of his shawl over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a ten million rubles reward we can look a little longer. This is the big one. . .  and all I need is the right girl.

dialogues.speaker: "A SOMEONE AND A SOMEPLACE"
dialogues.text: (Dmitri's "I want") Dmitri SINGS a reprise of Anya's song, a COMIC VERSION, in which he expresses the hope that he can find the right girl for his scam. Anyone from a peasant to a princess will do, as long as she can fool Tatiana. (NOTE:   We don't want to give Dmitri a whole new song here or we'll be too song-heavy in Act I. By giving him a short reprise of Anya's song, we can effectively align these two characters emotionally.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of various aspirants:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy hasal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Grandmama! It's me, Anastasia. I've waited so long to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stupid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. . .  Grandmama it's me. Anastasia, I have waited so long, too. (as a good-bye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next! ACTRESS 4 looks like a hooker and sounds like Mae West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. . . Grandmama. . .  It's me. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be on the outside anymore.  The ten million rubles would make me welcome anywhere.  I'd really belong somewhere - if I could just find the right girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very round ACTRESS 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Grandmama. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my modivation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out to seats)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanislavski!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO STANISLAVSKI
dialogues.text: shrugs innocently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next! ACTRESS 7 is actually a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. . .

dialogues.speaker: ON DMITRI
dialogues.text: in a state of disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta find the right girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya rides up to front of the theatre and drops her bike.  She rushes the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: now empty as Dmitri and Vladimir are gathering up their things to leave.  Vladimir still wears the remnants of the evening clothes that he worein the first scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use, Dmitri - we'll never find the right girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will.  We have to. (trying to cheer him up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Vlad - she's out there. They walk out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could be right under our nose Anya is running up the stairs as Dmitri walks out and they COLLIDE:  her forehead banging Dmitri literally under his nose.  Dmitri grabs his upper lip in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over reacting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch!  That really hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. . .  I'm. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's quite a hard head you've got there, boy. In her old hand-me-down boys clothes andhat pulled low, she could easily be mistaken for a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Dmitri.  I need traveling papers - to Paris. I heard Dmitri could help me. Vladimir and Dmitri exchange a look. . .  wary. . .  Dmit looks around and motions to Vladimir to handle it while he walks ahead nonchalantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you hear it from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard it from everyone who said I didn't hear it from them!   Do you know Dmitri? Dmitri keeps walking ahead followed by Vladimir. Anya is determined not to give up and keeps up with Vladimir even though she keeps getting bumped and pulled off track by people walking in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly, acting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Providing travel papers is illeagal! (then, quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Dmitri well - perhaps I can help you.  Providded you have enough money to pay for this service. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't have any money . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day! Vladimir pats her on the head and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a bike!  Perhaps I could sell it and. . .  Vladimir keeps walking, catching up to Dmitri. Anya runs back around to the front of the building where she left her bike.  She stops suddenly when she realizes that there is no bicycle there anymore - just Meetoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?  And where's my bike? A POLICEMAN strolls by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer!  My bike has been stolen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense.  There is no crime in the Soviet Socialist Republic. And he keeps walking. Anya realizes that there is no hope in pursuing the policeman so she heads off to find Vladimir - who has vanished down the street.  Meetoo starts to follow her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, boy, I have to go. Meetoo barks "retu" and starts after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You can't come with me. I'm leaving. . . Meetoo barks his "retu" and starts after her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like you're saying "me too".  Listen little guy, I have money, no food. . .  and no bicycle.  I'm the last person you should be following! Anya pats him on the head and heads off in the direction of Vlad and Dmitri.  Meetoo, of course, follows her.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: Anya spots Vladimir and Dmitri turning the corner in the distance.  Anya runs, trying to catch up with them.  She turns the corner and STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the PALACE in the distance, only now it's run down, boarded up and partially burned. Anya is taken back.  She stares, fascinated by it - moved by it .  As the sun sets behind the Palace, it's bathed in a beautiful golden light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a roaring fire, over which Vladimir has fasioned a roatating "spit" which is propelled by a Victrola.  Vladimir is carefully basting the only thing on the spit:  a head of cabbage. Dmitri is sitting by the window, staring at the MUSIC BOX that Anastasia dropped the night of the revolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . .  even if we find her, what makes you think the Empress will even see us? Dmitri holds up the music box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya approaches, tentative and glancing around.  She tries to open the door but it won't budge, so she moves to a boarded up window.  She looks through a crack in a board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and eerie.  All of it's former glory destroyed. CAMERA RISES to a partially destroyed CHANDLIER ehere we see BARTOK, the bat who was with Rasputin. He hangs upside down next to a FEMALE BAT.  He clears his throat - she doesn't respond.  Using his wings, he gives his "hair: a quick grooming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, uhh. . .  hang here often? (laughs nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hang" get it?  I said "hang" and we're both, you know, cause we're bats. . .  and, uhhh. . . what's your sign? No reaction from FEMALE BAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya uses a stick to pry off some of the window boards. We HEAR a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAME CRACK noises from downstairs just as Vladimir's cabbage falls from the spit into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off noise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was your dinner!  I do hope there is no cabbage in Paris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta' ya say we go somewhere - maybe get a bug to eat.  Get it?  A "bug" to eat, 'cause we're. . . FEMALE BAT rolls her eyes in disgust and flaps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (one last try)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Gemini. . .  He hears the SOUND of boards being torn off the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya climbs into the ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meetoo manages to wiggle in after her and follows Anya as she wanders around, spell bound by the faded glory of the palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya wanders into the partially destroyed room and bends down to inspect half of a broken plate that's lying on the floor. The instant she touches it, she pulls her hand away as if SHOCKED.  Recovering, she picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: PLATE
dialogues.text: painted with decorative dancing Russian bears. Anya wanders out of the room and to the top of a HUGE STAIRCASE which leads down to the once grand BALLROOM. She stops at a large landing half way down the steps. Meetoo sees a large curtain hanging precariously on the side wall.  Being a puppy he can't resist leaping and grabbing at it with his teeth.  Anya notices and runs her hand along a the carved butterflies in the worn banister.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANYA
dialogues.text: who jumps, startled, as Meetoo pulls the curtain and it hits  the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dmitri and Vladimir look up from their burnt cabbage. They heard it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya is relieved to see it is only Meetoo, who wags his tail happily with the curtain still in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you do. . . Anya STOPS mid sentence, taken by what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the curtain was the FRIEZE of the ROMANOV FAMILY. The moonlight hits the portrait with a ghostly glow.

dialogues.speaker: "ONCE UPON A DECEMBER", (THE MUSIC BOX THEME)
dialogues.text: Anya is mesmerized by the FRIEZE.  She looks around the Ballroom. . . almost remembering something. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: ONCE UPON A DECEMBER
dialogues.text: As she sings the ballroom transform into it's once spledid glory.  Anya takes off her coat and at once her rags are transformed into a beautiful gown.  NICHOLAS steps down from the FRIEZE and walks her down the stairs gracefully and begins a waltz with her.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS MY MEMORY.
dialogues.text: MUSIC BUILDS.  A CHORUS of voices sing the melody as royal ghosts appear as elegant and beautiful as in the opening scene. Then

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: Dmitri and Vladimir appear at the top of the stairs. DMITRI & VLADIMIR'S POV some ragged lunatic dancing with "himself".

dialogues.speaker: THINGS IT YEARNS TO REMEMBER
dialogues.text: Anya is released from Nicholas' embrace.  He kisses her on the forehead and slowly backs away.  She follows Nicholas, back up the stairs to the landing, where the sun has caused a "dust" mist. Then, magically, TATIANA appears through the mist, a loving beautiful vision from the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: END NUMBER
dialogues.text: Dmitri's voice causes the visage to disintegrate.  All goes back to the way it was - dark and destroyed. Anya spins toward Dmitri, surprised and frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya is caught in a ray of moonlight, directly in front of the image of Anastasia in the frieze.  The resemblance is striking.  Dmitri is taken aback, but Vladimir is unaffected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trespassing, boy! Anya is dazed by what has just happened to her and can't quite refocus on reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I. . .  I. . .  spoke to you earlier about traveling paper. .  Dmitri pokes Vladimir with his elbow but doesn't take his eyes off Anya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Vlad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! Vladimir looks at Anya again and get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Dmitri?  I didn't  mean to trespass - I don't want to do anything dishonest, but if you could just help help me. . . Vladimir and Dmitri walk down the stairs and up her stairs and begin to circle around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you heard of our brilliant plan to find a girl and. . .  Dmitri pokes him hard in the ribs and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Vlad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't want to do anything "dishonest". . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets it, whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew. . .  the honest type. Dmitri gives Vlad a "let me handle this" gestures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off frieze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like her.  Like the Princess Anastasia.  Has anyone ever told you that before? Anya is coming back to her senses, doesn't like these men circling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah - in the orphanage they constantly told me I looked like a princess! Stop that! Dmitri stops circling and then begins to use everything that Anya says - the perfect and charming con man that he is - to get what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People say Anastasia was the only member of the Royal Family to escape alive.  That makes  her an orphan too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know - I don't remember anything that happened before the revolution. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's strange - Anastasia's grandmother, the Dowager Empress Tatiana has been looking for Anastasia since the revolution.  Why do you think she wouldn't go to her own grandmother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I don't see what this has to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it's because she has amnesia too - can't remember. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you weigh? Dmitri pokes him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dmitri)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just wondering since we already have the dress. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I came here to get papers to travel to Paris and. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to go to Paris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anastasia's grandmother is in Paris.  We're going to bring Anastasia to her - in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think you are the Princess Anastasia. Anya laughs.  Vlad mouths to Dmitri "Do you think she's really Anastasia?"  Dmitri shakes his head no, of course not, then continues with Anya.  Vlad smiles to himself and walks down the stairs - Dmitri's so good even he got confused!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never thought of the possibility?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - there isn't an orphan in the world who doesn't dream she's a princess but, come on. . .  Look at me! Dmitri spins spins around, dramatically pointing to Anastasia's image in the freeze.

dialogues.speaker: HER
dialogues.text: (beat, then softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be you.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERSCORE
dialogues.text: Anya fiddles with the key around her neck and looks down at the ballroom, remembering what just happened there - could it have been a memory. . .  Dmitri tries to act casual as he turns and starts walking down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have anything to lose.  If I am wrong - the Empress will simply tell us you aren't Anastasia and we'll be on our way.  No harm done - an honest mistake - but at least you will be in Paris. Anya touches Anastasia's painted hand in the frieze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing in a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: THINGS IT YEARNS TO REMEMBER. . .
dialogues.text: Dmitri looks at Anya, her back toward him, as he raises his arm to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out the truth - come to Paris with us. Anya expression registers her internal debate.  What is it's true. . .  It coudn't be. . .  but if. . .  Then,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  I will go with you. Meetoo let's out his "retu".  Vladimir lets out a whoop of joy.  Dmitri smiles and bows to Anya..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Her Royal Highness Princess Anastasia!

dialogues.speaker: ON BARTOK
dialogues.text: having watched the whole thing - he sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oy. . .  he's gonna be so mad. . .  Bartok flies out a broken window and into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city lights fade and we move into the blackness of the Russian forest.  Finally, in the distance, we see the orange glow of a fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartok swoops along the wagons.  Everyone looks to be asleep.  Bartok keeps flying until he sees an OMINOUS LOOKING BLACK WAGON, the largest and most elaborate. Bartok screws up his courage and flies into the open window of the BLACK WAGON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing in a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: THINGS IT YEARNS TO REMEMBER ...
dialogues.text: Dmitri looks at Anya, her back toward him, as he raises his arm to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out the truth - come to Paris with us. Anya expression registers her internal debate. What if it's true... It couldn't be... but if... Then,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I will go with you. Meetoo lets out his "retu". Vladimir lets out a whoop of joy. Dmitri smiles and bows to Anya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Her Royal Highness Princess Anastasia!

dialogues.speaker: ON BARTOK
dialogues.text: having watched the whole thing - he sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oy. . .  he's gonna be so mad... Bartok flies out a broken window and into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city lights fade and we move into the blackness of the Russian forest. Finally, in the distance. we see the orange glow of a fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartok swoops along the wagons. Everyone looks to be asle Bartok keeps flying until he sees an ONIOUS LOOKING BLACK WAGON, the largest and most elaborate. Bartok screws up his courage and flies into the open window of the BLACK WAGON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone candle lights the dark wagon. A frightened Bartok, stays on the window sill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm ... Father Gregori? It's, uhh ... me. Bartok. (a sign of relief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phew! Not home ... Rasputin's face suddenly ROARS into FRAME from the bed below, his eyes fiery red and his beard wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! (wing to chest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that ... feel my heart. Go ahead. I'm dying here ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you want, my little rat-with-wings? Rasputin rises and pours himself a glass of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name calling! That's mature. Rasputin grabs him by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave you that tongue and I can rip it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I really like my tongue... we're very attached. (rasputin releases him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oyyyy... Okay, now... promise you won't get angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I ever be angry with you, little friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Keep that thought okay? So, I'm in town, stop by the old palace. You get a better class of bats there - no tattoos or anything. Rasputin rummages around for a full bottle of vodka, tossing the empties - which Bartok has to dodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'm cruisin' the rafters and... what can I say, I struck out. I thought chicks would like the fact that I can talk, you know but, I mean, the way things are going I couldn't get invited to a plague. (a bottle smashes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's gotta clean that up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the point sometime tonight.. I'm late for a wenching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... you're not gonna like this but, well, it looks like Anastasia is ... still alive. He tenses, waiting for Rasputin's explosion but Rasputin just laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible. That rumor's been around for years. Bartok hovers face-to-face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, it's her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes narrowing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodent's intuition, how do I know? She looks exactly like her. Except she's taller, which        is natural ... Of course my second cousin Treplev - he never        grew. Looks like a little pepper shaker. He was so cute ... Rasputin begins a slow growl that builds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oyyy... I knew this was gonna to upset him! Rasputin howls in anger and smashes his glass against the wall. He moves toward the CABINET, knocking over furniture. Rasputin flings open the cabinet and we see the RELIQUARY, glowing gently as if it were sleeping. Bartok covers his eyes in fear. Even Rasputin seem a bit nervous in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with reverence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Source of my power. Owner of my soul. I need your help. Rasputin takes the RELIQUARY out of the cabinet and sets it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, she's just a kid. And she's going to Paris outta sight, outta mind, outta Russia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cursed then all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Aunt Bella, sweet woman not the brightest bat in the world - she used to hang right side up, anyway she always said "Curses were made to be broken". Course, she said it in those irritating little bat squeaks, so it wasn't quite so profound... Rasputin pulls out a set of RUSSIAN DOLLS (a small painted. hollow doll with a smaller doll inside it, and a smaller doll inside it, etc.) The first doll bears an eerie resemblance to Nicholas. Inside the second looks like Alexandra, all the way down to the ANASTASIA doll.

dialogues.speaker: "THE END OF THE LINE", (PRODUCTION NUMBER)
dialogues.text: Rasputin will have a DARK, MENACING, DELICIOUSLY SCARY NUMBER in whIch he SINGS of his obsession with killing the Romanovs once and for all. Bartok will interject comically throughouut. as Rasputin          will conjure up tLis minions from the iquary and sing about Romanovs FINALE, he sends them off after Anya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Romanovs tried to kill me and I swore to destroy all of them! If she lives, if she should have a child someday, the Romanov Family continues! And I won't lot that happen! THIS IS THE END OF THE LINE! He crushes the Anastasia doll in his massive hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this is really obsessive behavior. There is this doctor this doctor in Austria, Sigmund something and he feels. . .  Bartok land on the table while be's talking and his wing accidently knocks the RELIQUARY on its side and it begins to roll.

dialogues.speaker: YOU IDIOT
dialogues.text: Rasputin makes a sad leap, grabbing it seconds before it shatters on the floor.        Rasputin holds it up. The smokey SPIRITS inside swirl around, moaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Reliquary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesses - you'd all like to get out, wouldn' t you? Sorry just one at a time and only when I call. Rasputin spins an Bartok, who Us been slinki away, and slams a goblet over his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From under the glass, Rasputin looks distorted and even more horrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bartok)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what would happen if that broke?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice under glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd lose your security deposit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving reliquary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evil, powerful beings - I have their power only if I contain them, control them. If they should all be released at once... well ... Rasputin smiles with his horrible yellow, decayed teeth, and lifts the glass an if to whisper in Bartok, a ear.

dialogues.speaker: IF THAT HAPPENS
dialogues.text: The volume of Rasputin's voice rattles Bartok around the inside of the glass. Rasputin focuses on the RELIQUARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to reliquary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Where is Princess Anastasia... Inside the reliquary the awoke begins to mow Suddenly, the smoke EXPLODES in a burst and forms into the smoke from a train engine. As the reliquary picture broadens, we see a train and Anya, Dmitri and Vladimir all hurrying to catch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has friends. No matter... Bartok looks desperate under glass. He trios to topple the glass prism by jumping up but just cooks his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh, that was dumb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to Rasputin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, I've get really terrible claustrophobia. That's why I could never live in a cave ... Rasputin gives his attention only to the reliquary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish my prophecy... Smoke begins to pour out of the reliquary. asput almost giddy with the thought of finishing ambition, laughs hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew, I hate when he does this! As Rasputin swirls his arms the smoke begins to form into MINIONS. All look human at first, but then we see MINION ONE, has the body of a human and a head of a JACKAL, MINION TWO has the face of a woman and the claws of a TIGER, and MINION- the most horrible of all - has a huge bear-like body with the head of a VULTURE. All wear long capes with hoods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is not to get off that train... alive! Rasputin kicks open the wagon door and leaps outside. The MINIONS, still filling out into forms, follow. One of the wisps of smoke, like a tail, swishes by and knocks over Bartok's glass prism, freeing his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rasputin releases his BLACK HORSES who stoup -and whinny, men ing something bad, as two Minions float on to them the other flies ahead of than.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! I don't care what you do with the others but finish the girl! KILLLLL HERRRRR! (sinister)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have fun... The Minions take off. Rasputin laughs wildy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TATIANA'S HANDS covering her face. Slowly dropping her hands down to reveal an older, sad TATIANA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her away, Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: to reveal a YOUNG WOMAN standing in front of bar desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't anything better to do than to break my heart. Sophie ushers the now ashamed YOUNG WOMAN to the door. The YOUNG WOMAN looks amazing like Anya except that her hair is long and her clothes are now. She walks with a certain regal grace until she passes through the doorway out of Tatiana's sight - and her posture "question-marks" and she lopes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more. So more... Sophie. heavier and larger bottomed than ten years earlie speaks quickly - without ev er breathing, in a high pitched nervous chitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very rapidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, oh... I must say. I thought that one was bar - i'm just so shocked that she wasn't real well, she was real, I mean she was human, of course. but not our real. I must say, even my sisters were touched by her yes - yes they were... XENIA and ESTELLE, as pinched and skinny as Sophie in "full", don't appear to ever have been "touched" by anything (or anyone).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... moved to tears of joy! We won't be f ooled next time, girls! I'm a going to think of really hard questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping Sophie with a raise of her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sophie. My heart can't take it anymore! I will see no more girls claiming to be Anastasia. Tatiana walks sadly out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya and Metoo doze near a fire along with the other PEASANTS waiting for the train. Dmitri looks over Vladimi shoulder nervously watching his forging their travel pape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up with those papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you have leaned over Rembrant's shoulder and told him to paint faster? Vladimir looks at Dmitri's anxious face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably would. (hands his the papers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still wet. A TRAIN WHISTLE SLOWS and Vlad Moves to Anya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, young lady, that's our train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wake up, your highness" - we should start getting used to saying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a world - a man who was in my position in society is calling a peasant 'Your Highness". Dmitri leans over and tugs Anya's hair lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Anya)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up! Anya's  eyes flash open and - totally on reflex - she bel Dmitri in the nose. Ditri reels back,  lands on his butt Vladimir observes ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a lot of work to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vladimir, using his ample belly, bumps people out of the way as they head for the train. Vlad climbs on just as it starts up, followed        by Dmitri. Dmitri turns bac reaches out his hand to help Anya up. But she freezes... just STANDS THERE, not running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Dmitri on the train, his band extended - just like Tatiana's was. Although Anya can't quite remember, something about this terrifies bar. She snaps out of it when Meetoo nips her ankle. Anya looks down and sees the puppy, picks his up and runs for the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my hand! Anya puts Meetoo into his hands and Jumps on without touching his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compartment is JAMMED with travelers. Suitcases and packages balanced precariously. Dmitri sits down and carefully touches his painful noso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you always punch people first thing in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry - it's a reflex. Living in an orphanage if someone bothers you - you automatically come up swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't bothering you. I was trying to wake you up! OVER ANYA'S SHOULDER, out of the window. we see the THREE MINIONS on horseback charging down a snow covered hill toward the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By pulling my hair?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was all out of dynamite! Dmitri touches his nose again. Anya opens the window and grabs some snow.        WE SEE the minions racing wil to catch up with the train. As the scene continues, we see the minions,        by one, getting close to the trai and then disappear from        view - only their riderles horses ride away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands Dmitri the snow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on your nose. For heaven's sake, you're making such a fuss! Dmitri tries to act very manly as he puts the ice on his nose, but cringes with the cold. Anya smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men are such babies... An ELDERLY WOMAN loaded with packages cones into the compartment. Anya immediately rises to help her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me Dmitri and Vlad both pull her back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a princess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royalty do not help people with their luggage. Anya gives them both a look and helps the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she certainly has a mind of her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And I hate that in a woman. Vlad holds Meotoo, who is enthralled and plays with Vladimir's drooping mustache, like a kitten with a string The COMPARTMENT DOOR swings open and an OMINOUS LOOKING GUARD strides in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papers! Everyone rustles for their papers. Dmitri confidently pulls out their papers, done in beautiful BLACK ink. Then, he glances at the PERSON NEXT TO HIM and sees that his papers are done in a bright RED ink. Dmitri looks over at Vladimir - who has seen the mistake as well

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what I hate about this government - everything in red! The guard hand papers back to a soulful looking man with a frozen beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Comrade Zhivago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Zhivago. GUARD approaches Vlad and Dmitri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pray he's color-blind... Dmitri flashes the Guard a charming smile as he hands over his papers. Vladimir is nervously playing with his mustache until it stands out straight. Anya has no idea what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wait here. As the Guard heads out of the compartment, Vlad turns to Dmitri and they exchange an "oh, no" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MINIONS, hoods pulled low, push their way through the PASSENGERS in search of Anastasia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dmitri spots the GUARD conferring with the GUARDS over the papers. Anya pokes bar head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to stretch my legs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good idea - a great idea - stretch your legs (pointing the opposite direction of the guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... stretch then that way. Anya looks at him like he's crazy and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have hit him harder than I thought... Dmitri runs back in and grabs his SMALL BACKPACK. He pulls Vlad, carrying Meetoo, out off the compartment Anya has a load on them as they follow.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAIN COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: The GUARDS burst in, ready for an arrest. In the background, the hooded Minions pass. The Guards, seeing empty seats, head back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya looks out the window as the country side flies by and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards spot three figures at the far end of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's them! Come on! They run after who they think are the fugitives. The Guard grabs a minion and spins him around. It's MINION THREE, who comes face-to-beak with him and lets out a HORRENDOUS SCREECH, causing the other Minion to turn around. The Guards scream and reel backwar pushing and shoving each other to got out of the way The Minions proceed up the corridor, MINION TWO, spot Anya looking out the window. He grabs her. palling her viciously to the other Minions. She spins around - it isn't Anya - it's a SERIOUSLY UGLY WOMAN. The Minions now scream and reel back in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dmitri and Vladimir catch up to Anya and grab her in each arm, loading bar down the hall WE HEAR the MINIONS SCREAM from the next car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya. Dmitri and Vlad step out on a platform and see there is no place left to run. Only the engine is ahead of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here! He leaps up gracefully, grabbing the edge of the roof, and pull& himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vlad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to tell what we are... as Dmitri's head, upside down, appears from the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Vladimir picks Anya from up from tobehind and hoists her up to Dmitri. She hollers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anya is pulled up by Dmitri, with a force that knocks them both over Anya on top. An awkward moment. Anya rolls off him as Dmitri tries to catch the breath she knocked out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what do you think you're doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying... to... breathe... Suddenly, Meetoo appears, as if he were flying and lots out a little "retu". Vladimir has tossed his up and Dmitri catches his, band his to Anya, and reaches down to Vladimir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though the window the Minions see Vladimir's legs as he's being lifted. INT. ROOF oF TRAIN Dmitri struggles to got Vlad to the roof but he's losing his grasp. Anya puts Meetoo down and reaches to help the dangling Vlad. Even Meetoo helps by pulling an Vladimir's  scarf .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minion one grabs for Vladimir's legs, just as they disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dmitri and Anya let out a sigh of relief as Vlad in safe, but it's short lived as they both SIMULTANEOUSLY lot out a yell. DMITRI & ANYA'S POV: a TUNNEL rapidly approaching. They hit the deck, Vlad on his back between Anya and Dmitri.        Anya and Dmitri exchange a quick look as t tunnel gets closer - Vladimir's stomach is sticking up too high to clear the tunnel. They reach up together and push down on his big belly, causing his eyes to bulge

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SIDE OF THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: The minions, now climbing up the side are plunged into total darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: light hits as the train comes out of the tunnel. Vlad lets out a gasp as they release his belly. Just then a Minion hand reaches up over the edge. Dmitri assumes it's a Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards! (Anya gives his a lack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll explain later. Anya and Vlad follow Dmitri toward the back of the train.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MINIONS
dialogues.text: now on the roof, seeing their prey in short distance.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANYA AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: running, without looking back. jumping from car to car, passing Meetoo like a football. Vladiair makes a huge running leap into the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As all PASSENGERS react to Vladimir's bulk hitting and denting the coiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRAIN WHISTLE erupts and Anya glances back to see her pursuers just as they are enveloped in the thick blac smoke of the engine. Behind them, Anya can another tunnel

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: They drop down, this time Vlad in on his stomach. Anya and Dmitri realize his butt won't clear the tunnel. They push it down.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MINIONS
dialogues.text: An the smoke disappears, the Minions' eyes go wide when they realize it's too late for them. The train roars the tunnel as the MINIONS SMASH &"'not the sift of the mountain in a COLORFUL BURST OF SMOKE from which they were created.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rasputin stares at the scene in his reliquary, watching his well laid plan *go up in smoke", and lots out a simmering growl. Anya is standing with her hands an her hips arguing with Dmitri and Vladiair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forged papers! Now, what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now just get off the train.

dialogues.speaker: HUH
dialogues.text: Dmitri motions that they are going to Jump. Anya shakes her head slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's quite right, Dmitri, a man of my stature should not have to Dmitri shoves him off the top of the train with Meetoo in his arm. Dmitri then puts out his hand to Anya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we'll jump together... Take my hand. Dmitri turns forward and sees the train is approaching a HIGH RAILROAD BRIDGE over a rocky ravine. It's now or never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! With his outstretched hand, Dmitri shoves her off the bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vladimir has landed in a large pile of snow. He stands, rubbing his bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I have hurt my... Meetoo comes out of the pile of leaves, rubbing his bottom and answers Vladimir's with his "retu". A short distance away, Anya seems to be sitting on top of a puddle - but she isn't wet. Suddenly, Dmitri gets up from underneath her, covered in snow. Anya isn't wet because she landed on Dmitri! She jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must enjoy causing me pain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have pushed us! Vladimir and Meetoo come over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everyone all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine! (limping away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may never walk right again, but she's fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rasputin paces, still angry at the Minions. Bartok, nervous, fakes a yawn and stretches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I better got goin'. Got a busy day letting all the blood rush to my head... Rasputin pulls him back in, then speaks to his reliquary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's too far away, isn't she? The reliquary glows eyes. Rasputin places It back in it's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesss... our power is much stronger when were near. We must get close to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
